comment: A subword of a "repeated symbol word" is again a "repeated symbol word". The assumption N <_ L is required, because otherwise ( L < N ): ` ( ( S repeatS L ) substr <. M , N >. ) = (/) ` , but for M < N ` ( S repeatS ( N - M ) ) ) =/= (/) ` ! The proof is relatively long because the border cases ( ` M = N ` , ` -. ( M ..^ N ) C_ ( 0 ..^ L ) ` must have been considered. (Contributed by AV, 6-Nov-2018.)
